title: Morena (political party) - Wikipedia
snippet: The National Regeneration Movement (Spanish: Movimiento de Regeneración Nacional), commonly referred to by its syllabic abbreviation Morena ([moˈɾena]), is a left-wing political party in Mexico. Founded in 2011 by Andrés Manuel López Obrador as a civil association and registered as a political ...

title: Movimiento de Regeneración Nacional (Morena) - Explainer | Wilson Center
snippet: Morena, Movimiento de Regeneración Nacional (National Regeneration Movement), was created in 2014 as Andrés Manuel López Obrador (AMLO) led an exodus of politicians from across the entire political spectrum into a new political party.

title: How Morena Broke Mexico’s Glass Ceiling — International Relations Review
snippet: Claudia Sheinbaum of the far-left ... predecessor, Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador, widely known by his initials AMLO, founded the Morena party as a personal campaign vehicle for himself and his allies in 2012....

title: Morena | Political Party, Mexico, Andrés Manuel López Obrador, & Claudia Sheinbaum | Britannica
snippet: Founded in 2014 by Mexican politician Andrés Manuel López Obrador, it stresses an anti-corruption agenda, supports energy nationalism, and advocates policies traditionally associated with left-wing ideologies in Latin America.

title: The Rise of Morena
snippet: Morena was founded in early 2013 when it split from the PRD over the latter’s support for neoliberal structural reforms. The PRD had itself emerged in 1989 as a left-wing electoral alternative to the long-dominant Institutional Revolutionary ...
